articles.title: es-toolkit: A Modern JavaScript Utility Library
articles.description: Think Lodash but newer, faster, smaller, and with tree shaking and built-in TypeScript support. The reference guide shows off the supported functions so far ‚Äì it‚Äôs not quite as extensive as Lodash, but it‚Äôs getting there with the goal being ‚Äúto achieve full feature parity with Lodash.‚Äù
articles.author: Viva Republica, Inc

articles.title: What's Coming Next for ESLint
articles.description: At eleven years old, ESLint is preparing itself for another eleven years by continuing to evolve into a language-agnostic linter that anyone can write plugins for. The new configuration system introduced in ESLint 9.0 is ‚Äújust the beginning of significant changes‚Äù on the way.
articles.author: Nicholas C. Zakas

articles.title: Speeding up the JavaScript Ecosystem: Isolated Declarations
articles.description: ‚ÄúTypeScript‚Äôs new isolated declaration feature is a game changer for sharing code among developers.‚Äù The latest in Marvin‚Äôs fantastic series about finding performance wins in how we do things in the JS world.
articles.author: Marvin Hagemeister

articles.title: Recreating the THX 'Deep Note' in JavaScript
articles.description: A fun bit of sound generation with Tone.js. Note that people have reported mixed results on different browsers, but it works for me. Just be careful it doesn‚Äôt ‚ñ∂Ô∏è explode your teeth.
articles.author: Alexander Keliris

articles.title: Introducing @let in Angular
articles.description: The new @let syntax extends Angular‚Äôs built-in template syntax with a better way to define variables inside component templates.
articles.author: Mark Thompson and Kristiyan Kostadinov

articles.title: Sneaky React Memory Leaks: How the React Compiler Won‚Äôt Save You
articles.description: While the new and exciting React Compiler can tackle a lot of issues and make most codebases more performant, it pays to be aware of tricky edge cases.
articles.author: Kevin Schiener

articles.title: React Flow 12: Create Node-Based Editors & Interactive Diagrams
articles.description: Part of xyflow, this makes it easy to create node-based UIs where you have interactive components wired together however you choose. There's a Svelte version too.
articles.author: Moritz Klack and John Robb

articles.title: Croner 8.1: 'Cron' Triggering and Evaluation
articles.description: Trigger functions to the schedule of your choice using cron syntax. It can also evaluate cron expressions to give you a list of upcoming times.
articles.author: Hexagon

articles.title: TinyBase 5.0: A Reactive Data Store for Local-First Apps
articles.description: A data store that acts as a reactive backend to your apps if you want less headache building out backends. v5.0 includes a new mergeableStore type that can wrap your data as a Conflict-Free Replicated Data Type (CRDT). Homepage.
articles.author: James Pearce

articles.title: PLV8: Use JavaScript Functions in PostgreSQL
articles.description: Did you know you can use JavaScript within Postgres for things like stored procedures and triggers? PLV8 is the extension that makes it happen. PLV8ify adds an extra layer by converting JS/TS files into PLV8 ready SQL.
articles.author: PLV8JS Development Group

articles.description: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è A side-by-side comparison of publishing a module to npm vs JSR.
üéôÔ∏è Vue creator Evan You went on the DejaVue podcast to talk about the last ten years of Vue.
üó£Ô∏è JavaScript-powered text-to-speech in the browser is getting very good.
Efforts are being made to integrate SQLite into Node.js.
pnpm 9.5 ‚Äì The efficiency-focused package manager introduces Catalogs, a way to have shareable dependency version specifiers.
Node.js v22.4.1 (Current), v20.15.1 (LTS) and v18.20.4 (LTS)
Deno 1.45, Angular 18.1

articles.title: The Magic of Clip Path
articles.description: This post sets out to ‚Äúinspire you and show you that thinking outside the box can lead to some great animations‚Äù ‚Äî all via the magic of the very powerful clip-path CSS property.
articles.author: Emil Kowalski

articles.title: 15 Page Speed Optimizations That Sites Ignore (at Their Own¬†Risk)
articles.description: Optimizations to put in place, including some fairly easy low-hanging fruit, to improve your page performance.
articles.author: Tammy Everts

articles.title: Interop 2024 Mid-Year Update
articles.description: As we head into the second half of the year, Rachel shares a look over how Interop 2024 has helped improve web interoperability this year so far and what key Baseline features we‚Äôve seen up to this point.
articles.author: Rachel Andrew

articles.title: State of Text Rendering 2024
articles.description: A highly detailed look at free and open source fonts, how the text rendering landscape has advanced over the past decade or so, and where support for various features currently lies. There was plenty of related discussion for this one over on Hacker News.
articles.author: Behdad Esfahbod

articles.title: Exploring the Challenges in Creating an Accessible Sortable List
articles.description: The accessibility team at GitHub consider drag and drop actions to be a ‚Äúhigh-risk pattern‚Äù ‚Äî as such they‚Äôve been working on developing a more accessible solution for this highly interactive interface. This post looks at the challenges faced, and how they solved them.
articles.author: Kendall Gassner (GitHub)

articles.title: Script Integrity
articles.description: This web platform feature (the integrity attribute on script and link elements) can help against third parties changing the code that they are providing.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: Zoom, Zoom, and Zoom
articles.description: A post exploring the intricacies of the three types of browser magnification and their CSS equivalents. If you want to understand zoom in the browser, this is a good place to start.
articles.author: Miriam Suzanne

articles.title: How Keyboard Navigation Works in a CSS Game
articles.description: You may recall a few issues ago we featured this Chromium-only CSS Mario game ‚Äî now here‚Äôs a look at how it works, specifically moving Mario with keyboard input. All HTML/CSS, no JavaScript.
articles.author: Temani Afif

articles.title: CSS One-Liners to Improve (Almost) Every Project
articles.description: A collection of handy, simple one-line CSS solutions to add little improvements to any web page.
articles.author: Alvaro Montoro

articles.title: "If" CSS Gets Inline Conditionals
articles.description: Distilling some thoughts on the potential if CSS conditional, along with some additional details and tidbits that are worth knowing about this proposed idea.
articles.author: Geoff Graham

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Are Web Components Worth It?
articles.description: Jake and Surma chat about web components, why they were invented, what they‚Äôre useful for, and how they could improve.
articles.author: Off The Main Thread podcast

articles.title: YouTube Embeds are 'Bananas Heavy' and It‚Äôs Fixable
articles.description: A good performance PSA worth remembering.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: Batman-Comic.CSS
articles.description: A fun caped crusader comic library that allows ‚Äúchildren to play with HTML and quickly see the power of CSS‚Äù.
articles.author: Alvaro Montoro

articles.title: Font Interceptor: Download the Fonts in Use on a Target Site
articles.description: Enter a URL and this tool will generate direct links to all the fonts the page uses. Sounds sketchy but it‚Äôs replacing the extra steps needed to do this with your browser‚Äôs DevTools.
articles.author: MSCHF MAG

articles.title: Braille-Tools: CSS and JavaScript to Display Braille
articles.description: Designed for displaying English Braille Grade 1 for sighted people and available in three different styles (big, small, small 3D). Lots of demos here.
articles.author: Olivier Giulieri

articles.title: Nho: Tiny JS Library for Easy Web Component Development
articles.description: A simple solution for kickstarting your Web Components, to avoid the sometimes unnecessary stuff found in similar tools.
articles.author: Daniel Le
